para.text: Who May File.
In a contest for public or party office:
A candidate who, based on the certified results, was defeated in that election may petition for a recount, as provided in Election Law Article, §12-101, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
An opposing candidate of the petitioner may counterpetition for a recount, as provided in Election Law Article, §12-102, Annotated Code of Maryland.
In a contest for a question on the ballot:
Any registered voter eligible to vote for that question may petition for a recount, as provided in Election Law Article, §12-103, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
Any registered voter eligible to vote for that question may counterpetition for a recount, as provided in Election Law Article, §12-104, Annotated Code of Maryland.
Contents. The petition shall specify:
Whether the recount is requested for:
All the precincts in which the contest was on the ballot, or
Only certain precincts, to be designated in the petition;
The recount method authorized by this subtitle the petitioner selects to use; and
The order in which the precincts named in the recount petition should be counted.
Where and When Filed. The petition shall be filed within the time and with the State Board or local board as specified in Election Law Article, Title 12, Subtitle 1, Annotated Code of Maryland.
Bond. The petition shall be accompanied by a bond, as provided in Election Law Article, §12-105, Annotated Code of Maryland.
Signature. The petition shall be signed by the person seeking the recount, as authorized by Election Law Article, Title 12, Subtitle 1, Annotated Code of Maryland, or that person's authorized agent.

section.heading: Cost Estimate.
section.text: Before beginning the recount, the local board or local boards subject to the recount and State Board shall jointly estimate and inform the petitioner of the anticipated:

para.text: Number of hours needed to complete the recount; and
Cost per hour.
Notice Required.
By the end of the next business day following the receipt of a petition, the local board shall deliver to the persons listed in this regulation:
A notice of recount, in the form specified by the State Board; and
A copy of the petition or information on where the petition is posted on the Internet.
The notice of recount shall specify the date, time, and place of the recount.
Notice to Candidates, etc. A notice of recount shall be given to the following:

For the recount of a contest for party or public office, to all candidates in the contest, including write-in candidates who have filed a certificate of candidacy under Election Law Article, Annotated Code of Maryland;
For the recount of a ballot question, to representatives of supporters and opponents of the question, to the extent they are known to the board;
For the recount of a contest for delegate to a national party convention, to authorized representatives of the presidential candidates to whom the candidates for delegate are pledged;
For the recount of a contest for president and vice-president of the United States, to the candidate or the candidate's authorized representative; and
For the recount of a contest for continuing an appellate judge in office, to the judge seeking continuance in office.
Notice to State Board. For every recount, a notice of recount shall also be given to the State Board.

section.heading: Notice to Voting System Vendor.
section.text: Upon receipt of a petition, the local board shall provide to the voting system vendor the notice required in Regulation .03A of this chapter.

para.text: In General. The recount shall be conducted by the local board, with the assistance of:
The board's regular staff; and
If needed:
Substitute board members;
Additional temporary staff, including individuals who served as election judges in the same election; and
State Board staff.
Compensation of Substitute Members. If a substitute board member participates in the recount, that member is entitled to compensation at a rate established by the local board.

section.heading: Personnel—Election Director.
section.text: Subject to the directions of the State Board of Elections and the local board, the election director shall supervise the recount.

para.text: Election Director to Appoint. The election director shall appoint one or more special teams, as may be needed for conducting the recount.
Qualifications. A person appointed to a special team must be a member, a substitute member, or a regular or temporary employee of a local board or the State Board.
Composition.
Each special team shall be comprised of two or more members.
When practicable, at least two of those members shall have different party affiliations.

section.heading: Personnel—Instructions; Assignments.
section.text: Before the recount begins, the local board shall:

para.text: Instruct all personnel in their respective duties; and
Have them complete and sign a recount assignment sheet, in the form specified by the State Board.
Start Time. Except as provided in Regulation .10 of this chapter, the recount shall begin within 2 business days of receiving the petition.
Continuation.
The recount shall continue daily, at least 8 hours each day, until completion.
The board may suspend the recount on Sundays and State holidays.

section.heading: When Canvass Not Yet Completed.
section.text: If a petition for recount is filed before the official canvass is completed, the local board shall finish the canvass and then conduct the recount.
